channel.title: So i got windows 7 on the way
channel.description:
Just wondering.. Im guessing ill have to format my pc and install windows 7 that way?
I only have 40gb space left on my Hard drive.. Really cant be arsed backing everything up and doing it that way.. since i hardly have any time anyways.
Would i be able to create a partition and gradually make it bigger as trade things over?

item.title: So i got windows 7 on the way
item.dc:creator: @Cbot Cbot
item.description:
@Cbot wrote:

As people said just make sure you install Win7 so you get that windows.old folder
Once you’re done moving your stuff away from Vista just run a disk cleanup to delete any crap you left in the windows.old folder and you’re pretty much good to go

Read full topic
item.source: So i got windows 7 on the way

item.title: So i got windows 7 on the way
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

TheBeanie:

But then wont it take up more space with vista still technicly installed?

Yes it would take up more space, but what I did is I moved my documents from windows.old to my new Documents folder, then just deleted all of windows.old. Really not too big of an operation, windows.old has all the vista files so deleting that gets rid of everything.

Read full topic
item.source: So i got windows 7 on the way

item.title: So i got windows 7 on the way
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

you can just put the cd in and install it from windows itself, you don’t even need to reboot until it does it for you.

Read full topic

beanie, if your careful with what you click, you should be able to install windows 7 without reformatting, like someone said, all your old files will go int a folder called windows.old in the C directory.

item.title: So i got windows 7 on the way
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

You can partition and do it the way you said, but its a bastard and you’ll most likely do something wrong and end up not being able to resize partitions without fucking something up. Just back your shit up and do a full reinstall.

Read full topic

item.title: So i got windows 7 on the way
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

When you do a full installation it puts everything you have now in a folder called windows.old, iirc. So there would be no need really.

Read full topic
